faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: Econometric modeling with implementation of different methodological tools and methods. Properties and analysis of estimators. Regression analysis with cross-sectional data, panel data, pooled data, time series, micro- and macro data.  Multiple regression analysis with qualitative information. Preparing and discussing of an econometric project using  software package R.
description.et: Õppeaines käsitletakse ökonomeetriliste meetodite kasutamise võimalusi majandus- ja sotsiaalprotsesse iseloomustavate  erinevate andmevalimite (ristandmed, aegread, paneelandmed; ühendatud andmed, mikro- ja makroandmed) korral. Võimalik on saada  teadmisi ökononomeetrilisel modelleerimisel kasutatavatest erinevatest metodoloogilistest lähenemistest ja meetoditest, klassikalisest ökonomeetrilisest modelleerimist, mikroökonomeetrilistest meetoditest,  paneelandmete ja aegridade analüüsist. Ökonomeetrilise analüüsi läbiviimine toimub statistikapaketi R baasil.

objectives.en: To develop theoretical and practical knowledge and skills for applying econometric tools for analysing economic and social processes and implementing software package R by using different types of data: cross-sectional data, time series, pooled data, panel data, macro data, micro data.
objectives.et: Omandada  süvendatud teadmisi ja oskusi ökonomeetriliseks modelleerimiseks kasutades  selleks tarkvarapaketi R võimalusi ning erinevaid andmeid: ristandmed, aegread, paneelandmed, ühendatud andmed, mikro- ja makroandmed..

learning_outcomes.en:
Knowledge  on the methodology and  methods for buiding,  estimating and analysing econometric models relying on different types of data: micro- and macro data, cross-sectional data, time series, pooled data, panel data. 
Skills of implementing software package R for estimation, analysis and diagnostics of econometric models. 
Skills to  collect and analyse socio-economic data, to correctly specify, estimate  and analyse econometric models, to discuss the results of econometric modelling, preparing and presenting econometric projects.
learning_outcomes.et:
Teadmised ökonomeetrilise modelleerimise metodoloogiast ja ökonomeetriliste mudelite hindamise meetoditest ning nende matemaatilis-statistilisest tagapõhjast. 
Teadmised ja oskused ökonomeetrilise analüüsi läbiviimiseks kasutades tarkvarapaketti R ning erinevat tüüpi  andmeid: makro- ja mikroandmed, ristandmed, aegread, ühendatud andmed, paneelandmed.   
Süvendatud oskused selliste probleemipüstituste formuleerimiseks, kus lahenduste leidmisel on abi ökonomeetrilisest modelleerimisest. 
Oskus komplekteerida sobivaid andmevalimeid ning viia läbi ökonomeetrilist analüüsi ja mudelite diagnostikat erinevat tüüpi andmevalimite  korral.
Kogemused ökonomeetriliste mudelite püstitamiseks, hindamiseks, analüüsimiseks ning tulemuste sisuliseks tõlgendamiseks ja diskuteerimiseks koostades ja kaitstes ökonomeetrilist projekti.

independent_work.et:
Home assignments. Details are given during the course
Content: estimation of a linear model, least squares method, interpretation, tests,

debt_elimination.en: Date of the final exam will be set during the course. If a student fails in this final exam or simply doesn't take this final exam, then there will be the resit exam. The exact date will be decided during the course.
debt_elimination.et: Date of the final exam will be set during the course. If a student fails in this final exam or simply doesn't take this final exam, then there will be the resit exam. The exact date will be decided during the course.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et: Introduction, causal relationships, data types, partial effects, conditional expectation, conditional variance, data types, discussion of ceteris paribus effects, simple regression models, ordinary least squares estimation, properties of OLS estimation, goodness of fit, effect of measurement units, functional forms, unbiasedness of OLS estimators

Simple regression models (continued), homoscedasticity, heteroscedasticity, estimating error variance, variance and standard errors of OLS estimators, multiple regression models, ceteris paribus effects of variables, interpreting partial effects in multiple regression, comparing simple and multiple regression estimates, goodness of fit, unbiasedness of OLS estimators in multiple regression, perfect collinearity, omitted variable bias

Multiple regression models (continued), variance of the OLS estimators, components of OLS variances, multicollinearity, variances in misspecified models, estimating the standard errors of OLS estimators, Gauss-Markov theorem, dummy variables and partial effects, heteroscedasticity.
LAB class, by teaching assistants: R examples on simple and multiple regression, on single and joint coefficient testing
LAB class, by teaching assistants: exercises related to multiple regression analysis. Examples on multiple regression and inference.
LAB class, by teaching assistants and test
Review Linear Regression and Logistic Regression from a Data Science Perspective, Introduction to Big Data and Machine Learning Methods
Cross-Validation and Resampling Techniques, Shrinkage Methods
Ensemble Methods, Basics of Deep Learning, Unsupervised Learning Methods
Introduction to Text Mining, Sentiment Analysis
